column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Mr Burrows'''.<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]] & [[Christina Scull]]
column3: "[http://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/chronology.html Addenda and Corrigenda to ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology'']" at [http://www.hammondandscull.com/index.html HammondandScull.com] (accessed 29 November 2011)</ref>

column1: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien discusses the signing of a copy of ''[[The Hobbit]]''
column2: his change of address and recent health issues.<ref name=Bloom>[http://www.bloomsburyauctions.com/detail/614/495.0 Lot 495] at [http://www.bloomsburyauctions.com/ Bloomsburyauctions.com] (accessed 29 November 2011)</ref>

column1: *'''Publication:''' A description and photograph of the letter was included in ''[[Bloomsbury Modern First Editions
column3: English and Continental Literature and History 24 May 2007]]''.<ref>[http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=74200 Modern First Editions. 2007] at [http://www.tolkienbooks.net/ TolkienBooks.net] (accessed 29 November 2011)</ref>

column2:
Thank you for kind & appreciative letter. I return your 'Hobbit' cover signed.

You have not discovered my address: I left Oxford a year ago. I now live in 'retirement' —in an endeavour to preserve some time free from interruptions. All letters will be forwarded from the above below address. I have been unwell during July and this added to the forwarding by the P.Office must be my excuse for delay. Best wishes. Yours sincerely

J.R.R. Tolkien}}
